sentences: Ta hirmutas naabrit tulekahjuga seni, kuni see korstna ära parandas.
context: The Estonian word 'hirmutab' is the 3rd person singular present form of the verb 'hirmutama'. It means to frighten, terrify, intimidate, or scare someone/something. This can refer to causing fear in people through threats, punishment, or scary stories (definition 1), or it can mean scaring animals away from a place by making them feel threatened (definition 2). The word comes from 'hirm' which means fear.
